intro: Ptychosema pusillum, commonly known as the small bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap microscopic organisms. The plant typically grows in freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. It has a simple morphology with short, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. Ptychosema pusillum is often found in nutrient-rich environments and plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms.
